com.ibm.team.interop.common
Interface IExternalState

All Superinterfaces:
IAuditable, IAuditableHandle, IExternalStateHandle, IItem, IItemHandle, IManagedItem, IManagedItemHandle
public interface IExternalState
extends IExternalStateHandle, IAuditable

Class to represent the replicated state associated with a proxy for an external object.

Since:
0.5

getState

setState

void setState(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> state)
Set the state as a property name of name/value pairs.

Parameters:
state - the external state to set as a map of property name/values

encodeContentDescriptor

java.lang.String encodeContentDescriptor(IContent content)
Encode a Content descriptor into a String. This method is used by an external client when it uploads a file that is to be used as the value of a Content property for an item. The incoming value of the property corresponding to the Content should be set to the value generated by this method.

Note: only binary or unspecified line delimiter content is supported; that is, the line delimiter type must be set to LINE_DELIMITER_NONE

Parameters:
content - the Content object to encode
Returns:
a string encoding of the Content descriptor

decodeContentDescriptor

IContent decodeContentDescriptor(java.lang.String contentDescriptor)
Decode an encoded Content descriptor back to a Content object. The receiving item manager should use this method to get the Content object that was uploaded by an external client. It claims that Content by setting it as the value of some property on the item being synchronized (and then saving the item).

Parameters:
contentDescriptor - the encoded Content descriptor
Returns:
the decoded Content object
